meanings.sent1: The town crier was heralding the arrival of the king.
meanings.sent2: The teacher heralded the start of the school play.
meanings.sent3: The parrot hilariously heralded the morning by mimicking a rooster.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the sunset heralded the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The loud trumpet heralding the victory could be heard throughout the stadium.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds heralding a storm made everyone prepare for rain.
meanings.sent2: The ringing of the bell heralded the beginning of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat heralded its hunger by meowing loudly at the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums heralded the approach of the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop in temperature heralded the arrival of winter.

meanings.definition: To serve as a sign or omen
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing their path heralded bad luck for the day.
meanings.sent2: The howling of the wolves heralded danger in the night.
meanings.sent3: The broken mirror heralded seven years of misfortune, according to superstition.
meanings.sent4: The blooming of the cherry blossoms heralded the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star streaking across the sky heralded a wish coming true.
